A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I created a Rotten Tomatoes account just to say that I wish I had never seen this movie. It's one of those movies where the creators felt a need to be \"original\" but didn't actually have the talent to match their ego\, so they decided to be ironic instead. They ended up making a movie that's original in the same way a painter who doesn't know how to draw must create something deliberately bad so they can't be accused of trying to make something good.\n\nThe whole movie is a sequence of storytelling gimmicks that are meant to surprise you without actually telling a story. None of the story lines lead anywhere\, and none of the characters learn or do anything meaningful. In the process of shot-gunning gratuitous plot twists to keep you from following asleep\, the creators pretty much made a joke of Star Wars. It's just another Transformers franchise now. Even the Harry Potter sequels knew when to let things end.
